text.base: You push open the door. The bell chimes, a sharp, nervous sound. The diner smells of stale coffee and floor wax. Behind the counter, Maude is pouring coffee into a mug that is already full.

lens.believer: She was at the hotel five minutes ago. There is no back door. Distance is a suggestion to her, not a rule.
lens.skeptic: It's a small town. People work multiple jobs. But she hasn't changed her clothes. And she isn't sweating.
lens.haunted: She looks up. Her eyes are the same gray as the static on the TV. She knows you're wondering how she got here. She thinks it's funny.

counter.description: Worn formica. Coffee rings overlap like a Venn diagram of despair.

tv.description: An old CRT monitor. The reception is nonexistent. Faces form in the snow.

on_success.text: The coffee is mud, but it's hot. It centers you.

on_fail.text: Maude watches your hand shake. 'Nerves, hon?' She smiles. It's not a kind smile.
